intro: Galium natalense, commonly known as Natal bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky outcrops. Galium natalense is often found in the Eastern and Southern regions of South Africa.
